Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk e2fsprogs
exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi

islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: e2fsprogs bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The e2fsprogs packages provide a number of utilities for creating, checking, modifying, and correcting any inconsistencies in the ext2 file systems. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the chattr(1) and lsattr(1) manual pages did not document which file attributes were supported on individual file systems. This update adds a list of supported attributes to the ext2(5), ext3(5), and ext4(5) manual pages. With this update, chattr(1) and lsattr(1) now refer to file-system-specific manual pages for this information. (BZ#1053885) On an IBM Power Systems host, the resize2fs utility did not properly handle resizing of an ext4 file system to a smaller size. As a consequence, resize2fs terminated unexpectedly with a segmentation fault. The corruption of extent-based files on the big-endian variant of IBM Power Systems has been fixed, and resize2fs no longer crashes in the described situation. (BZ#1081836) On a corrupted ext4 file system, running the "resize2fs -P" command could cause the resize2fs utility to terminate unexpectedly with a segmentation fault. A patch has been applied to fix this bug, and resize2fs no longer crashes in the above-described scenario. (BZ#1104612) Users of e2fsprogs are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
